nobvisual package¶

Nob Visual Package

Submodules¶

nobvisual.cli module¶

command line of nob visualizee

nobvisual.nob2nstruct module¶

Convert a Nested object to a circlify object¶

Nob-struc is a description of a Nob compatible with a Circular packing representation, using the circlify package API.

nobvisual.nob2nstruct.build_nstruct(nob)¶

Build the nested_structure of a nested object.

Parameters

nob – a nested object for exampke the content of a YAML or JSON file.

Returns

nested dicts of type

{
    "id": name,
    "datum": 1.,      # <- tot nb of children
    "children: [ ],   # <- if children list of nesting here
}

in a list. This is compatible with the circlify package.

nobvisual.tkinter_circlify module¶

Browse a circlify object with tkinter¶

nobvisual.tkinter_circlify.tkcirclify(circlify, holder=None, color='#777777', shade=0.2)¶

Generate a Circlify in a Tkinter canvas.

Parameters

  • circlify – a ciclify object, list of Circles objects.

  • color – hex coloer, for background of circles.

  • shade – shading, making nested levels lighter (>0) or darker (<0) in range of floats [-0.5, 0.5]

Interrupt the process with a tkinter canvas.

nobvisual.visualtree module¶

Draw the circular packing of a folder tree.¶

nobvisual.visualtree.visual_tree(wdir=None)¶

Show the circular nested packing of a directory tree.

The circular packing is computed using the circlify package. The graphical output is done using tkinter. Area of circles is proportional to lthe log10 of file sizes. ASCII-UTF8 files are blue, others (usually Binary) are in green.

Params wdir

path to a working directory. If None, set to current working directory.

Open a tkinter window with the circular packing.
